oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Photograph of Mayor Beverly Briley and Vice Mayor George H. Cate, Jr. shaking hands, 1963, April 1
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Nashville Banner photograph of Mayor Beverly Briley and Vice Mayor George H. Cate, Jr. shaking hands at their inauguration as the first mayor and vice mayor of the new Metropolitan Government of Nashville and Davidson County.

The consolidation of City of Nashville and Davidson County governments into the Metropolitan Government of Nashville and Davidson County (Metro) was the first consolidation of a city and a county government in the nation. Voters elected Beverly Briley mayor, George Cate vice-mayor, and a council of forty persons and the day the officials took office was the same day that the consolidation of the city and county governments took effect.
